def.dt: :to sprinkle or cover with or as if with powder
:to reduce or convert to powder
:to hit very hard
:to become powder
:to apply cosmetic powder

entry.et: Middle English poudre, from Anglo-French pudre, podre, from Latin pulver-, pulvis dust; probably akin to Sanskrit palāva chaff

def.dt: :matter in a finely divided state :particulate matter
:a preparation in the form of fine particles especially for medicinal or cosmetic use
:fine dry light snow
:any of various solid explosives used chiefly in gunnery and blasting
river 150 miles (241 kilometers) E Oregon flowing into the Snake
river 375 miles (604 kilometers) N Wyoming & SE Montana flowing N into the Yellowstone
:a pale blue
:a flask for carrying gunpowder
:one made of the horn of an ox or cow
:a small usually metal cask for holding gunpowder or blasting powder
:something liable to explode

:a branch of science or an art concerned with the production of powdered metals or of metallic objects by compressing a powdered metal or alloy with or without other materials and heating without thoroughly melting to solidify and strengthen
:a person who carries or has charge of explosives (as in blasting operations)
:a small fluffy device (as a pad) for applying cosmetic powder
:of, relating to, or being a traditionally male activity or event done or played by women a powder–puff football game
